critique: The document is an executive order establishing an emergency board to investigate a dispute between The Long Island Rail Road and its employees. It is a fairly neutral document that follows the Railway Labor Act. There is little to suggest any strong ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on social inclusion. The primary focus is on resolving a labor dispute through established legal mechanisms. The order does expand executive power slightly by creating the board, but this is within the bounds of existing legislation. It has a slight impact on economic regulation by preventing changes to the conditions out of which the dispute arose for 120 days.
